Hi Jocelyn,

My initial feeling is that the global reaction, so long as elements
balance and whatnot, should be implemented just the same as any
elementary reaction.  Can you send the cti file?  There may be
something in how the reaction is written that's making cantera think
it doesn't pertain to the phase you've created.

Also, I'm wondering in what way does the code 'not recognize the
reaction'?  If you create the phase and then run the equations
'rxnEqs(phase name)', does it return the reaction string?  Does
'nReactions(phase name)' give the correct number of reactions? 
Anyway, if you attach the cti file, perhaps one of us here can see if
anything in there is causing the problem.

Best,
Steven



--- jocie_squirl <jocie_squirl@...> wrote:

> I was wondering if anyone was using a global one step reaction in
> Matlab.  I am trying to 
> get the reaction CH4 + 2 O2 => CO2 + 2H2O to work with some of the
> demos (diffflame).  
> I was able to create a cti file but it seems the flame code doesn't
> recognize the reaction.  If 
> anyone has successfully used a one step, global reaction with any
> of the flame code?
> Thanks,
> Jocelyn
> 
> 
>
